Classical.Structure: The 'Where' or 'How' pathway. Extends from the primary visual cortex (V1) to the parietal lobe.
Classical.Function: Processes spatial information, including motion, depth perception, and the location of objects in space. Guides motor actions (e.g., reaching).
Classical.Pathology: Optic ataxia (inability to guide reaching), motion blindness (akinetopsia).

SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: Processes high-temporal-frequency visual information (magnocellular pathway) to detect motion and spatial relationships.
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Formalizes tissue-level dynamics via phase-coupled oscillators, quasicritical operation (Griffiths regimes), and multi-path coupling (gap junctions, ephaptic fields, glial/vascular slow control). Models entrainment to cosmological rhythms (Schumann, lunar) via biophotons and cryptochromes.
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: Provides the L5 self-model with the spatial map of 'self-in-world', necessary for navigation and interaction with the environment.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'GPS' of the self, plotting the organism's position relative to its environment and guiding its physical path through 3D space.

Falsification_Hypotheses: Lesions to the dorsal stream will impair object recognition, but not spatial navigation.
Neurons in area MT (middle temporal) will fire in response to color, not motion.
Experimental_Protocols: fMRI or single-unit recording during motion-detection tasks.
Simulation_Suite: Model motion detection using Reichardt detectors.
